refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Output is a series of pseudo-random positive integers. This is the technique used in so-called "Turing machine" synth modules and is usually used to generate melodic sequences. This implementation is adapted from the firmware for the Ornament & Crime module, as used in the Quantermain and Meta-Q apps.

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: ilen -- length of shift register, valid values are 1-31 (inclusive). The larger the length, the larger the resulting integers in the output. You can use this to constrain the output to a suitable range.
iprob -- probability, valid values 1-255 (inclusive). Controls the spread of the output; larger values result in a wider spread of values.
iseed (optional, default -1) -- initial state of the shift register, as a pattern of bits. The value is treated as an unsigned integer, so the default of -1 is effectivly all bits on (0b11111111...).
